name: sshguard
description: Protect from brute force attacks against SSH
unavailable_reason: Repository is on bitbucket, not GitHub. Limited analysis available.

readme.summary: Clear purpose statement but lacks concrete examples and relies heavily on external documentation links.
readme.top_issue: No inline quick start example showing actual usage - users must navigate to multiple external files to see how to use sshguard

common_complaints: Subnet/IP range detection limitations - attackers spreading attacks across subnet ranges evade detection
Log format parsing issues - failures with RFC5424, syslog-NG fractional seconds, and process names with dots
Limited service detection - missing support for Dropbear SSH server on embedded systems
praise_themes: Excellent project contribution to open-source community
sentiment.summary: sshguard shows moderate community health with users appreciating its lightweight design but requesting improved attack detection sophistication and broader log format/service compatibility support.

concerns: No commits in past 6 months despite being December 31, 2025
6 open issues with no recent activity
Zero merged PRs in past 6 months
No active contributors in past 6 months
Unknown last release date indicates lack of version management
positive_signals: No open pull requests suggests low demand for changes
Closed issues in the past indicate some historical maintenance
maintenance.summary: sshguard appears to be stale with no active development, unresolved issues, and no recent releases.

analysis_summary.unavailable_reason: Repository is on bitbucket, not GitHub. Limited analysis available.
